{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3212743,"name":"Jose Laureano","username":"thedudeJose","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thedudejose/{size}/196486_2.png","created_at":"2023-06-06T14:57:43.706Z","cooked":"

My team is investing in swerve this offseason and we chose to use the WCP Swerve X modules. On the product page for the Swerve X, it says “Accepts 550, 775 & Falcon/CIM Motors.” I have two questions regarding this.

1 - Is this module compatible with NEOs?

2 - Can we use a NEO 550 for steering, like in the MAXSwerve modules?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-06-06T14:57:52.051Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":436,"reads":386,"readers_count":385,"score":2267.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":437931,"topic_slug":"wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility","display_username":"Jose Laureano","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56494,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility/437931/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3212746,"name":"Adam Fleming","username":"AdamF","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adamf/{size}/234717_2.png","created_at":"2023-06-06T15:14:04.356Z","cooked":"
thedudeJose:

1 - Is this module compatible with NEOs?

If it supports CIMs then it definitely supports Neos

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-06-06T15:14:04.356Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":376,"readers_count":375,"score":140.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":437931,"topic_slug":"wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility","display_username":"Adam Fleming","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41952,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility/437931/2","custom_user_title":"FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3212749,"name":"","username":"FinIce","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/finice/{size}/270519_2.png","created_at":"2023-06-06T15:18:19.868Z","cooked":"
  1. Yes, the Neo, Falcon and CIM all use compatible holes, and the Neo is the shortest of them all, just need a place for the Sparkmax.
  2. I would assume so, but length may be an issue if you are using the flipped version. You would need an adapter to fit the hole pattern, but those can be printed or bought. I would do some CAD mockups with the needed reductions on the Neo 550 and go from there.
","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-06-06T15:18:19.868Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":361,"readers_count":360,"score":122.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":437931,"topic_slug":"wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52870,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Amateur Historian?"},"post_url":"/t/wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility/437931/3","custom_user_title":"Amateur Historian?","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3212753,"name":"rah1236","username":"rah1236","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rah1236/{size}/159040_2.png","created_at":"2023-06-06T15:30:30.810Z","cooked":"

If you want to use a neo550, you’ll need to convert the 550 interface to a cim style one if you wanna use one for steering (Which I only CANNOT recommend, not because it wouldn’t work, but because you’ll save so much headache using a falcon or full size Neo). Andymark’s sport gearboxes have replaceable shafts that should make them compatible. You could also try looking for teams with spare Cimiles, but I wouldn’t hold my breath.

I’m a little confused as to why the SwerveX documentation mentions the 775 and 550 motors. There’s no obvious way to directly interface them as far as I can tell, and the docs offer no mention of how to use those motors anywhere I can see.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-06-06T15:30:30.810Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":325,"readers_count":324,"score":115.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":437931,"topic_slug":"wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility","display_username":"rah1236","primary_group_name":"Swyft-Robotics","flair_name":"Swyft-Robotics","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/1/1/11d561f5bb3f02abd1014df6f9a83d9ec434d6d1.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":64,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.vexrobotics.com/cimile.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":17},{"url":"https://www.andymark.com/products/2-motor-sport-gearbox-cimulator-shaft-and-plate?via=Z2lkOi8vYW5keW1hcmsvV29ya2FyZWE6Ok5hdmlnYXRpb246OlNlYXJjaFJlc3VsdHMvJTdCJTIycSUyMiUzQSUyMnNwb3J0K3NoYWZ0JTIyJTdE","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"2 Motor Sport Gearbox CIMULATOR shaft and plate - AndyMark, Inc","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32662,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Raheel R"},"post_url":"/t/wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility/437931/4","custom_user_title":"Raheel R","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3212757,"name":"steinra","username":"steinra","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/steinra/{size}/3823_2.png","created_at":"2023-06-06T15:39:33.423Z","cooked":"

We ran NEO on both drive and steer. The key thing to keep in mind is the NEO did not support continuous on the PID for the turn motors so we ran into issues there, but adapted the CANCoder to use for position feedback full time on the turn motors. Once we got over the basic issues it worked great for us. We still need to tune for odometry better we ran out of time in the season to get sysid figured out. Part of our off season work.

I should add you have to cut the shafts which is the one draw back we had. We did not like needing to dedicate the motors to the drive, but may look at that closer in the offseason to look at options to skip doing that.

Which also with cutting the shaft, you need to make sure the keeper ring that holds the gear in place covers the key shaft, otherwise the key will drop out and you will lose the ability to drive that motor. Don’t ask how we know that

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-06-06T15:41:32.772Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":290,"readers_count":289,"score":93.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":437931,"topic_slug":"wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility","display_username":"steinra","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10996,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility/437931/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3212761,"name":"Adam Fleming","username":"AdamF","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adamf/{size}/234717_2.png","created_at":"2023-06-06T15:42:56.946Z","cooked":"
thedudeJose:

2 - Can we use a NEO 550 for steering, like in the MAXSwerve modules?

I can see 2 possible ways of using a Neo 550

  1. Use it directly mounted, and change the pulley ratio as the Neo 550 free speed is about double that of the Neo.

  2. Use it similar to the MAXSwerve and have an Ultraplanetary or Maxplanetary in between to reduce the ratio. You would need to source a different motor pulley as the 2 available are for 8mm or the Falcon spline.

I personally would look at option 1. In either case I would double check the hole pattern first.

Edit: I didn’t notice there was a geared version as well, my post was only written considering the belt version.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-06-06T15:45:43.725Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":269,"readers_count":268,"score":68.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":437931,"topic_slug":"wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility","display_username":"Adam Fleming","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41952,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility/437931/6","custom_user_title":"FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3212768,"name":"Travis Norris","username":"TNorris","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tnorris/{size}/203666_2.png","created_at":"2023-06-06T16:02:42.713Z","cooked":"

Also a warning that some configurations use an interference fit 9T pinion gear that can be difficult to assemble.

We ran into this issue with the flipped gears configuration, but I haven’t checked if other configurations have the same pinion.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-06-06T16:03:41.771Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":243,"readers_count":242,"score":83.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":437931,"topic_slug":"wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility","display_username":"Travis Norris","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/swerve-x-pinion-help/423119","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Swerve X Pinion Help","clicks":21}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39882,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Head Coach - FRC 2423 | NEMC Planning Committee"},"post_url":"/t/wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility/437931/7","custom_user_title":"Head Coach - FRC 2423 | NEMC Planning Committee","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3212773,"name":"Rick Lance","username":"rlance","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rlance/{size}/8537_2.png","created_at":"2023-06-06T16:09:25.807Z","cooked":"

We used the flipped configuration with CIM motors for the steering and ended up switching out a couple of the gears so that we could use a 10T pinion instead of the 9T to avoid this issue.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-06-06T16:09:25.807Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":234,"readers_count":233,"score":81.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":437931,"topic_slug":"wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility","display_username":"Rick Lance","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":39882,"username":"TNorris","name":"Travis Norris","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tnorris/{size}/203666_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26112,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility/437931/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3212813,"name":"Andrew Lawrence","username":"Andrew_L","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andrew_l/{size}/270442_2.png","created_at":"2023-06-06T19:55:01.758Z","cooked":"

A friend of mine used NEOs and had to change some of the internal gear ratios to fit with gears available for the NEO, but it worked fine.

Like any product, you can modify it in any way you like, but you need the engineering background to verify the modifications will work. Personally, I’m of the opinion of that if you can’t verify the validity of the modifications yourself, you should stick with the stock option, but that’s just me.

Hello. Would you be able to help. We started a swerve X, but with neo’s all around , can coder and pigeon. Would you be able share code? We haven’t been able to get a code adjusted to can coders.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-01-19T02:48:24.545Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":13.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":437931,"topic_slug":"wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility","display_username":"Samuel Trevino","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":26112,"username":"rlance","name":"Rick Lance","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rlance/{size}/8537_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63303,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/wcp-swerve-x-motor-compatibility/437931/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3290258,"name":"Teddy","username":"dragonblade316","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dragonblade316/{size}/211424_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-20T22:42:06.359Z","cooked":"
samtrev622:

tarted a swerve X, but with neo’s all around , can coder and pigeon. Would you be able share code? We haven’t been able to get a code

I’m one of the team members that worked on this code.

Basically what we are doing is taking the CANcoders output as the current state and throwing that into a PIDloop.

Here is an example using code taken from last years robot:

import com.ctre.phoenix.sensors.CANCoder;
import com.revrobotics.CANSparkMax;

public class <insert classname here> {
  private CANCoder m_absoluteEncoder;


  public <insert classname here> {
    m_absoluteEncoder = new CANCoder(absoluteEncoderID);

    //you will need this so the absolute encoder is reporting the correct value
    m_absoluteEncoder.configMagnetOffset(/* this value will be different for each module*/);
  }
  
  public void update(SwerveModuleState desired_state) {
    m_angleMotor.set(MathUtil.clamp(m_turningPIDController.calculate(m_absoluteEncoder.getAbsolutePosition(), -m_desiredState.angle.getDegrees()), -maxTurnSpeed, maxTurnSpeed));
  }
}

This is not an exhaustive example but should give you a basic idea of where and how to use the CANcoder with Sparkmax.

Let me know if you have any questions.
